entries.meaning: comparative form of simple: more simple, less complicated or challenging.
(archaic) One who grows or gathers simples (medicinal herbs).
examples: One of the great pleasures in botany is, to produce a rather uncommon plant to those who know it to be curious; but the English botanist will not have much satisfaction in shewing it to a simpler, who is not acquainted with it under the name given by Gerard or Ray.
